title: Ajibade resumes Atletico training
body_text:
Super Falcons captain Rasheedat Ajibade has resumed fitness training with her club Atletico Madrid Women after sitting out their last two games due to a knock, PUNCH Sports Extra reports.
The forward shared a picture of herself working out with other teammates on Friday, ahead of their match against Tenerife on Sunday.
“Back at it,” she wrote via X.
Aside from missing Atletico Women’s last two matches, the 24-year-old had also missed the Super Falcons’ international Friendly against France in Angers last Saturday.
In October, she led the Super Falcons to two wins over Algeria in an international friendly, scoring a brace which secured a 2-0 win in the first leg at the Remo Stars Stadium in Ikenne.
Before she was halted by the injury, Ajibade has been in great form for Atletico Women, scoring five goals plus two assists in eight appearances.
In her great start to the season, she was crowned Spanish Liga F Player of the Month for September, beating other top players like Barcelona’s Ewa Pajor, Real Madrid’s Caroline Weir, Levante Badalona’s María Llompart, and Athletic Club Femenino’s Nerea Nevado to the award.
Due to her two-game injury spell, she is now fifth in the Liga F scorers chart with five goals, five goals behind Barcelona’s Pajor.
Her rise to prominence in Spanish football has been meteoric since joining Atletico Madrid in 2021. She has quickly established herself as a key player for the club, consistently delivering top-draw performances.
